description: The analysis subsystem follows a context-aware hierarchical refinement pattern. The process begins with the Meta-Context Analyst establishing project-wide constraints, which are passed to the Structural Abstractionist to map the high-level architecture. A Strategic Planner then manages the transition from this global view to granular "deep-dives" performed by the Component Detailer. The entire lifecycle is governed by a Quality Gate that enforces consistency between LLM insights and actual code structures, while Incremental Sync ensures the system only re-analyzes components impacted by recent code changes. All agents inherit from a unified Agent Foundation to ensure consistent LLM interaction and tool usage.

components.name: Meta-Context Analyst
components.description: Performs the initial "broad-brush" analysis of the project. It examines documentation, external dependencies, and file structure to establish the high-level architectural bias (e.g., project type, main frameworks) used to guide subsequent agents.

components.name: Structural Abstractionist
components.description: Identifies the primary system boundaries and top-level architectural patterns by analyzing the global control flow graph (CFG) within the context provided by the Meta-Context Analyst.

components.name: Component Detailer
components.description: Executes recursive, deep-dive analyses into specific sub-components. It maps local method-level flows and verifies internal logic against the actual source code.

components.name: Strategic Planner
components.description: Acts as the workflow orchestrator that evaluates the results from the Abstractionist to decide which components require further decomposition or targeted analysis by the Detailer.

components.name: Quality Gate
components.description: A critical validation layer that checks LLM-generated insights against the static analysis ground truth, providing corrective feedback loops to both the Abstractionist and the Detailer.

components.name: Incremental Sync
components.description: Optimizes analysis by tracking Git diffs; it determines which components have changed significantly enough to trigger a re-analysis, thereby managing LLM token consumption efficiently.

components.name: Agent Foundation
components.description: The underlying infrastructure providing the base classes for model-agnostic LLM interaction, tool integration (e.g., file reading, dependency checking), and tracing.

components.name: Validation Schema
components.description: Defines the shared Pydantic data models used for structured communication between agents, specifically for passing validation feedback and consistency insights.

components.name: Unclassified
components.description: Component for all unclassified files and utility functions (Utility functions/External Libraries/Dependencies)
